We are looking for Master's students majoring Computer Science or a related field 12-week internship role at our site in Gaithersburg, MD from May 18 2026 to August 7 2026.Position Description: Build information repository: Collect and organize insight summaries, including full context of the projects from Breast MDx team membersDesign: Develop and socialize product concept, collect user needs and requirements from a broader MDx team to inform prototype designBuild prototype data productTest basic functionalities: develop simple test cases and work with selected stakeholders to verify accuracy and functionalitySummarize the project and present to the organization stakeholdersPosition Requirements:Master's students majoring Computer Science or a related field Candidates must have an expected graduation date after August 2026.RequiredData/AI Literacy: Understanding of how AI-powered search or chat tools work; understanding limitations, responsible use, and prompting; willingness to learn quickly Rapid Prototyping: Demonstrated experience in assembling a working prototype, comfort using available platforms, templates, or low-code tools to demonstrate valueUser-Centered Product Thinking: Demonstrated experience in translating needs into simple, useful concepts; prioritizing must-haves vs. nice-to-haves; documenting basic requirements and success criteriaPreferredProject Management & Ownership: Planning a 12 week roadmap, managing tasks and milestones, and keeping stakeholders updated; delivering on time with a concise demo and documentationEnthusiasm for collaboration, cross-functional projects, public speaking, and presentation design.US Work Authorization is required at time of application.Ability to report onsite to Gaithersburg, MD site 3 days per week. This role will not provide relocation assistance.Compensation range: $37-$41 per hourDate Posted15-Jan-2026Closing Date28-Jan-2026Our mission is to build an inclusive environment where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. In furtherance of that mission, we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their protected characteristics. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please complete the corresponding section in the application form.

CHS Inc. is a leading global agribusiness owned by farmers, ranchers and cooperatives across the United States that provides grain, food and energy resources to businesses and consumers around the world. We serve agriculture customers and consumers across the United States and around the world. Most of our employees are in the United States, but today we have employees in 19 countries. At CHS, we are creating connections to empower agriculture.Summary CHS has an exciting opportunity in our Transportation/Supply Chain organization. We are looking for a Data Analyst Intern to help support a variety of projects that will range in scale and complexity. This is a full-time internship that is expected to start in May/June 2026. You'll work alongside a team of Business Intelligence Analysts, contributing directly to projects that optimize systems, improve efficiency, and support key business goals. This is a unique opportunity to collaborate daily with business and IT professionals, building your personal and technical skills as you gain exposure to the fast-paced, data-driven world of analytics at CHS. You must be able to commute to the headquarters in Inver Grove Heights, MN as this person will work a Hybrid schedule (3-4 days in the office).Responsibilities As a Data Analyst Intern, your assignments may include, but are not limited to: Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into technical solutions. Communicate insights and findings effectively to non-technical stakeholders. Data Extraction and Integration: Retrieve data from different sources (Snowflake, databases, APIs, spreadsheets, etc.). Clean, transform, and integrate data to create a unified dataset for analysis. Perform individual and business testing to ensure dataset accuracy. Dashboard and Report Development: Design and build interactive dashboards/reports using tools such as Power BI and Dataiku. Ensure that visualizations are user-friendly and provide meaningful insights. Documentation and Maintenance: Document data models, and BI solutions for future reference and maintenance. Regularly update and maintain existing BI solutions as per business requirements. Minimum Qualifications (required) Currently a junior or senior enrolled in Business Analytics, MIS, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Business Administration, International Business, Supply Chain, or related degree. Training/Experience with Microsoft suite of tools – e.g. Teams, Outlook, Excel, Power Apps, Power Automate. Experience with Data visualization tools – e.g. Power BI or Tableau. Excellent communication skills, customer focus, strong analytical and problem-solving skills, self-motivated with confirmed leadership abilities, presentation skills, and ability to function in a team-oriented environment with resource and time constraints. A passion for customers, analytics, and product quality. Additional Qualifications Training/Experience with database management technologies in the data analytics context Training/Experience with DAX and SQL Technical writing skills & coding skills in languages such as Python, Spark or R Training/Experience in data science areas, such as time series analysis and forecasting. Training/Experience with Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Training/Experience in Lean and Agile methodologies CHS offers a competitive total rewards package. Compensation includes base wage and, depending upon position, may include other earnings such as bonus, incentives and commissions. Actual pay offered will vary based on multiple factors which may include, without limitation, experience, education, training, specialized skills and certifications, minimum wage/salary requirements under local law. If eligibility requirements are met, you may participate in 401(k). CHS is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disability. Please note that any communication from a CHS recruiter would be sent using a chsinc.com email address. In addition, a CHS recruiter will not ask for confidential information over the phone or in an email, or request money from a candidate involved in an offer process. If you have questions regarding an employment opportunity, please reach out to chscareers@chsinc.com; to verify that the communication is from CHS.

Website: www.anglogoldashanti.com SUMMARY / OBJECTIVE OF ROLE The Operational Technology (OT) intern will be responsible for supporting the Operational Technology team on projects that may include developing dashboards to analyze software license usage, leveraging GIS and mine planning software to create spatial models (such as Virtual Reality) and writing procedures and guidelines. Role Accountabilities: Use ArcGIS and CAD software to create, manipulate, and validate 2D and 3D data in support of GIS, Virtual Reality (VR), and other spatial data projects for our global mining operations. Example data types include mine designs, satellite imagery, drilling, infrastructure, land boundaries, etc. Create PowerBI reports / dashboards to better understand license usage across some of our major software platforms Development of python scripts to automate data retrieval Support the documentation of above projects by contributing to procedures and guidelines, and the governance related to these An interest in gaming development or digital twinning (familiarization with Unreal Engine, Unity, or ArcGIS Reality is advantageous, but not necessary) Technical Competencies: Experience with mine planning and geology software platforms (Datamine, Deswik, Leapfrog Geo or Vulcan). Experience with GIS software (ArcGIS Pro) and relevant geospatial extension tools Ability to create dashboards for reporting and analytics (PowerBI) Experience with gaming development platforms such as Unreal Engine (advantageous, but not necessary) Leadership & Management Competencies: Detailed organizational, planning, and analytical skills. EDUCATION & QUALIFICATIONS: Undergraduate or graduate degree in Mine Engineering, Geology, Information Technology or Computer Science GENERAL KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE: In process of completing a degree in Mine Engineering, Geology, Information Technology or Computer Science A basic understanding of the mining value chain Problem-solving skills Be self-motivated; have an “investigative / curious” nature; and be driven to help the entire organization successfully achieve its goals Excellent verbal and written communication skills- listening, reasoning, speaking, and presenting COMPENSATION: Undergraduate: $27/hour Graduate: $35/hour AngloGold Ashanti Limited Reg No: 1944/017354/06 EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT AngloGold Ashanti North America Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type with regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Requisition Number: 72797 The company built on breakthroughs. ​ Join us.​ Corning is one of the world’s leading innovators in glass, ceramic, and materials science. From the depths of the ocean to the farthest reaches of space, our technologies push the boundaries of what’s possible. ​ How do we do this? With our people. They break through limitations and expectations – not once in a career, but every day. They help move our company, and the world, forward. ​ ​At Corning, there are endless possibilities for making an impact. You can help connect the unconnected, drive the future of automobiles, transform at-home entertainment, and ensure the delivery of lifesaving medicines. And so much more.​ Come break through with us. Corning’s businesses are ever evolving to best serve our customers, industries, and consumers. Today, we accelerate and transform life sciences, mobile consumer electronics, optical communications, display, and automotive markets. We are changing the world with: Trusted products that accelerate drug discovery, development, and delivery to save lives Damage-resistant cover glass to enhance the devices that keep us connected Optical fiber, wireless technologies, and connectivity solutions to carry information and ideas at the speed of light Precision glass for advanced displays to deliver richer experiences Auto glass and ceramics to drive cleaner, safer, and smarter transportation Scope of Position: Our Process Engineering – Data Analytics group partners with plants and central engineering to build analytics that improve yield, stability, and cost across high-volume manufacturing. You’ll contribute to Advanced Process Data Analytics projects (e.g., SPC modernization, anomaly detection, and model-in-the-loop improvements). You will design, build, and evaluate data solutions that transform raw manufacturing data into actionable insights. Expect hands-on work with Databricks (Spark), Python, and SQL to develop pipelines and statistical analyses that support process capability, control, and continuous improvement.Program Perks: Competitive salaries Assistance with housing and travel Meaningful project and final project presentation Intern Activities: Social and networking opportunities Weekly tech talks Community involvement Key Responsibilities: Data engineering & preparation: ingest, clean, and join sensor/mesoscale datasets in Databricks; implement validation and data quality checks. Statistical process analysis: apply SPC, capability studies, and time-series methods to detect drift and instability; communicate findings to process owners. Visualization & reporting: build clear notebooks/dashboards for operators/engineers; document assumptions, data lineage, and model limits. Collaboration: work with process engineers, manufacturing SMEs, and DT to prioritize backlogs and translate requirements into analytics deliverables. Requirements: Currently pursuing a BS/MS in Data Science, Industrial/Process/Manufacturing Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field. Coursework/projects in probability & statistics, data structures, and introductory ML. Practical experience with Python and SQL; familiarity with version control (Git) and collaborative workflows. Must be available for 10 weeks during Summer 2026 (May 27th – July 31st, 2026) with a graduation date of December 2026 or later. Be interested in working for Corning, Inc after graduation, if presented with a full-time job opportunity. Be willing to work at the posted job location Desired Skills: Exposure to Spark/Databricks and cloud data platforms (Azure/AWS); interest in lakehouse architectures. Knowledge of SPC and process-control concepts; prior work in a lab or manufacturing setting. Basic understanding of MLOps practices (reproducibility, validation, monitoring). This position does not support immigration sponsorship. ​The range for this position is $1,635.00 - $3,185.00 biweekly. Starting pay for the successful applicant is prescribed based on geographic location, nature of position, and year in school. A job that shapes a life. Corning offers you the total package. We prohibit discrimination on the basis of race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected status. Corning is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and considers requests for reasonable accommodations in accordance with applicable laws. Individuals with disabilities or sincerely held religious beliefs may request reasonable accommodations to participate in the application or interview process, perform essential job functions, or access other benefits and privileges of employment. To submit a request for reasonable accommodation related to disability or religion, please contact us at accommodations@corning.com.

job_title: Tech Program Intern 3 - Full Stack Engineering
job_description: What you’ll need to succeed as a Tech Program Intern III (Full Stack Engineering) at XPO: Minimum qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent and currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree 2 or more years of relevant undergraduate coursework Experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook) Strong computer skills and familiarity with administrative processes Preferred qualifications: Class status as a junior (3rd year) or greater 2 or more years of relevant software development coursework Development experience with at least one object-oriented programming language, such as Java, C#, C++, etc. Development experience with at least one JavaScript framework (Angular, React, etc.) Experience in web, mobile and responsive design Solid technical competency in coding and testing; good object-oriented programming language skills A portfolio that reflects intuitive, functional and original design Self-motivated and able to work well with minimal supervision or in a team environment; consult with team members and management as needed Ability to be open-minded and receptive to feedback in an intellectually rigorous environment Strong attention to detail and analytical skills with the ability to identify and resolve problems Good organizational skills with the ability to multitask Great verbal and written communication skills About the Tech Program Intern III (Full Stack Engineering) job What you’ll do on a typical day: Participate in 12-week program where you will gain exposure to specific stages of development such as front-end, back-end, deployment, and more. Collaborate with a fast-paced, extremely talented team that values collaboration and delivers high-quality results Develop software using technologies such as Angular 10+, C#, .NET core, Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Kafka and more Act as a catalyst to building frameworks and supporting application infrastructure Work as an active member of a tech team in the development and support of complex distributed systems Apply best coding practices and standards Support the development of APIs to support web applications Work in an agile start-up environment with daily standups and continuous integration About XPO XPO is a top ten global provider of transportation services, with a highly integrated network of people, technology and physical assets. At XPO, we look for employees who like a challenge and can communicate effectively in all situations. We want to leverage your skills and years of experience to drive positive results while ensuring a bright future for yourself and XPO. If you’re looking for a growth opportunity, join us at XPO. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran or other protected status. All applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment may be required to take and pass a pre-employment drug test. The above statements are not an exhaustive list of all required responsibilities, duties and skills for this job classification. Review XPO's candidate privacy statement here.

Job Title:Internship - Knowledge ScienceNumber of Positions:11Location:Okemos, MILocation Specifics:Hybrid PositionJob Summary:At Delta Dental of Michigan, Ohio, and Indiana we work to improve oral health through benefit plans, advocacy and community support, and we amplify this mission by investing in initiatives that build healthy, smart, vibrant communities for all. We are one of the largest dental plan administrators in the country, and are part of the Delta Dental Plans Association, which operates two of the largest dental networks in the nation.At Delta Dental, we celebrate our All In culture. It’s a mindset, feeling and attitude we wrap around all that we do – from taking charge of our careers, to helping colleagues and lending a hand in the community.We are looking for highly talented and motivated undergraduate or graduate students who are pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical fields. As a Knowledge Science Intern, you will: Work on cutting-edge knowledge-based computation platformsContribute to next-generation Al-enabled business rules frameworks, including Decision Modeling/Orchestration, Decision as a Service (DaaS), Domain Specific Language (DSL), etc.Gain first-hand experience on modern system architecture, such as Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA), Event-Driven Architecture (EDA) and enabling technology such as REST, JSON, Kafka, containerization, etc.Apply the fundamentals from Computer Science/Engineering curriculum onto real-world problems.Communicate your work to other teams and develop your skills explaining technical subjects to a business audienceA successful candidate will:Be self-motivated and able to contribute in a team settingExcel at problem solving, with strong analytical and critical thinking skillsHave demonstrated experience programming in at least one of the mainstream languages such as Java, Python, C++, etc.Show solid skills in data structure and algorithms design/analysisHave good understanding of software architecture, Object-Oriented (00) analysis/design, and commonly-used design patterns such as factory, composite, etc.Demonstrate understanding of core mathematical concepts for Computer Science, such as mathematical logic, set theory, etc.#LI-HybridMinimum Requirements:Must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program and have completed at least one course or equivalent experience with programming in Java, Python, C++, or other similar languages. The company will provide equal employment and advancement opportunity within the context of its unique business environment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin, familial status, citizenship, genetic information, disability, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, height, weight, military status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law or ordinance.

job_title: Technical Undergraduate Intern - Synthesis & Characterization - Metals
job_description: Dive into cutting-edge research and innovation with the Savannah River National Laboratory (SRNL)! The Trace Nuclear Measurement Technology Group is seeking an enthusiastic and talented undergraduate intern to join our team for ten weeks. This position provides a unique opportunity to contribute to a project involving the synthesis and characterization of metal oxide particles derived from feedstock solutions.

Job ID: 5964
Date Posted: January 15, 2026

Space Dynamics Laboratory (SDL) is seeking an undergraduate-level student to join our Geospace Program team for the summer. This internship is in Albuquerque, New Mexico. SDL provides a one-time housing and travel stipend, though Interns are responsible for making their own arrangements.

The selected candidate will assist in ongoing research activities involving atmospheric and ionospheric studies, working closely with other Scientists and Engineers to develop novel analysis tools. In this position, the candidate will refine their software engineering and data visualization skills to help develop internal data processing pipelines and existing web-based applications – ultimately changing the way we collaborate with the broader ionospheric and DoD community.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborates with Scientists and Engineers to determine application requirements
  • Updates existing analysis workflows based on user feedback
  • Extracts and transforms data into usable formats (e.g., HDF5, NetCDF, JSON)
  • Creates, tests, and implements robust database schemas
  • Designs necessary tests, including unit and integration testing
  • Documents and regularly presents progress
  • Designs software and APIs 

Required Qualifications:
  • Must be a US citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a US Government Security Clearance
  • Valid US driver’s license
  • Programming experience in Python
  • Familiarity with database systems and SQL
  • Experience developing web applications or with frontend development
  • Good communication skills, both written and verbal

Desired Qualifications:
  • Experience with API development
  • Experience with data analysis and visualization tools
  • Experience with command line interfaces, Git, SSH, Flask
  • Prior research experience

Education:
  • Currently pursuing a degree in computer science, data science, engineering, or a similar degree
  • Undergraduate student
  • 3.00 GPA minimum is required

Internship Length:
  • 12 Weeks, from May 2026-August 2026


SDL delivers advanced multi-domain solutions to protect national security and enable scientific discovery. Our expertise in satellites, sensors and instruments, ground systems and data processing, and autonomous systems plays a critical role in missions supporting NASA and the Department of Defense. Join our team of engineers, scientists, technicians, and business professionals in our seventh decade of delivering mission success.

At SDL, we strive to uphold a culture of respect, collaboration, empowerment, and accountability. We listen with open minds, seek to understand diverse perspectives, and engage in thoughtful dialogue. We work together by sharing knowledge, involving others, and offering support. We trust and empower our team members to take ownership, act with integrity, and be accountable. Above all, we deliver on our commitments to each other and to our mission partners.

The application window for this position is expected to remain open for approximately 7 days; however, it may be shortened or extended depending on business needs and the availability of qualified candidates. We encourage interested candidates to submit their applications promptly.

For questions, assistance, or accommodation with the application process or the DoD SkillBridge program, please contact employment@sdl.usu.edu.

api.fillList('requisitionDescriptionInterface', 'descRequisition', ['1066735','true','1066735','false','Submission for the position: Programmer Analyst Intern - (Job Number: 260000AH)','false','1066735','false','true','Programmer Analyst Intern','260000AH','!*!%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Cstrong%3EPROGRAM OVERVIEW%3C/strong%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EThe Massachusetts State Lottery Commission (“MSLC”) Summer Internship Program provides emerging leaders with the opportunity to build a foundational understanding of career pathways in public service through experiential learning opportunities.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EInterns will participate in weekly professional development workshops, mentoring opportunities, and conclude the program with a final presentation to showcase the insights they’ve developed over the summer.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Cstrong%3EJOB SUMMARY%3C/strong%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoBodyText%22%3EThe Enterprise Application Team builds and supports enterprise applications that are critical to lottery operations and digital player experiences through the Massachusetts State Lottery Commission’s (“MSLC”) agile software development practice. The team creates and maintains systems that support back-office functions such as claims and payment processing, retailer information management, instant ticket processing, and draw game operations. The team also supports enterprise data processing, including ETL workflows, databases, and application programming interfaces (APIs) used to enable remote ticketing and mobile integrations.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoBodyText%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoBodyText%22%3EThe Programmer Analyst Intern will join the Enterprise Application Team and assist software engineers in their day-to-day development and support activities within MSLC’s Java-based enterprise environment. Through close collaboration with the development team, the intern will gain hands-on experience across the software development lifecycle, learn and use modern development and collaboration tools, contribute to coding and analysis efforts, and gain exposure to enterprise systems, data processing, and emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI), while supporting the Lottery’s mission.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoBodyText%22%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3E%3Cstrong%3EESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS%3C/strong%3E%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EAssist with the development, testing, and maintenance of Java-based enterprise applications.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3ESupport applications running on JBoss application servers.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EParticipate in Agile development activities, including team meetings and sprint events.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EAssist in troubleshooting application and system issues.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3ESupport basic front-end development tasks using JavaScript, as needed.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EHelp document application functionality, technical processes, and system updates.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EAssist with research or proof-of-concept initiatives involving Artificial Intelligence, automation, or emerging technologies.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoNormal%22%3EPerform related duties as assigned.%3Co:p%3E%3C/o:p%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp class=%22MsoHeader%22
